abstract.para: The &productnamereg; ‐ is a Web interface that allows cloud administrators to manage various &ostack; services, like managing and creating images, creating keypairs, or attaching volumes to instances. It is based on &ostack; ‐ (also known as Horizon). taroth 2012-07-04: not sure about the CLI - if it has the same scope, a basic administration chapter in front of this one migth be useful to explain the underlying logic - maybe something for next revision
After a short introduction to the ‐, learn how to execute key administration tasks such as managing projects and users, adding images, adding flavors or setting quotas.

sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: The following requirements need to be fulfilled to access the &cloud; ‐:

listitem.para: The cloud operator has set up the &cloud; ‐ back-end. It runs on the node that has the nova-dashboard server role.

You have a recent Web browser that supports HTML5. It must have cookies and JavaScript enabled. For using the ‐'s VNC client, which is based on noVNC, your browser needs to support HTML5 Canvas and HTML5 WebSockets. For more details and a list of browsers that support noVNC, refer to , and , respectively.

sect1.title: &cloud; ‐—Overview
sect1.para: Learn how to log in to &cloud; ‐ and get a short overview of its Web interface.

sect2.title: Logging Into the &cloud; ‐ as Administrator
sect2.para: To access the &cloud; ‐, ask the cloud operator for the following information:

listitem.para: Public IP address of the node that has the nova-dashboard server role.
User name and password of the cloud administrator user with which you can log in to &cloud; ‐.

step.para: Start a Web browser and make sure that JavaScript and cookies are enabled.taroth 2012-07-04: DEVs, does the machine running the browser need to be in the same network like the node which provides the WEB UI? or can it be accessed from anywhere? cthiel 2012-07-05: that depends on the network setup of the customer
As URL, enter the IP address that you got from the cloud operator.

note.title: Certificate Warning
note.para: Depending on your browser and browser options, you may get a certificate warning when trying to access the URL for the first time. This is because in case no certificate is provided when setting up the ‐, &productname; uses a self-signed certificate that is not considered trustworthy per default.
To proceed anyway, you can add an exception in the browser to bypass the warning.

step.para: On the &cloud; ‐ login screen, enter the User Name and Password and click Sign In.
The ‐'s main screen appears, showing a Project and an Admin tab.

sect2.title: Main Screen (Administrator's View)
sect2.para: The top-level row of the main screen shows the username with which you are logged in. It also allows you to access the Settings or to Sign Out from the Web interface.

note.title: Available Functions
note.para: The visible tabs and functions in the ‐ depend on the access permissions of the user that is logged in.

sect2.para: If you are logged in as administrator, the main screen shows the following tabs: Project and an Admin.

sect3.title: Main Screen—Project Tab
sect3.para: The Project tab shows details for the projects (or tenants) that the user who is logged in belongs to.
Select a Project from the drop-down list at the left-hand corner to access the following categories:

listitem.para: Lists instances and volumes created by users of the project.
Lists images and snapshots created by users of the project.
Allocate or release floating IP addresses, manage security groups and keypairs.

sect3.title: Main Screen—Admin Tab
sect3.para: On this tab, you can access the following categories:

listitem.para: Lists all currently running instances belonging to various users and tenants. (Not all tenants may be visible to the administrator, though). From there, you can terminate, pause, or reboot any instances or connect to them via VNC.
Lists the available sizes of the VMs that users may launch.
Shows the custom images that have been uploaded. Lets you edit image properties or delete images, if needed.
Lists the available tenants. From here, you can create new projects and assign users to the projects.
Gives an overview of all users.
Lists the default? quota values that are allocated to all? users, such as the number of CPUs, RAM, or instances.

sect1.title: Managing Projects and Users
sect1.para: &productname; allows you to manage projects independently from each other. Projects represent different organizational units to which users can be assigned. During the basic system setup, the cloud operator needs to minimally define one project, one user, and one role to link the project and user. Roles define which actions users are allowed to perform.

As a &cloud; administrator, you can create additional projects and users as needed. The following procedures guide you through the main management tasks like adding, modifying or deleting projects and users. Learn how to assign users to one or multiple projects or how to change or remove the assignment.

step.para: On the Admin tab, select the Projects category.
To add a new project:
Click Create New Project.
In the window that opens, enter a Name and Description for the project and confirm your changes.
The ‐ automatically assigns an ID and shows the newly created project in the Projects category.
To delete one or multiple projects:
Activate the check boxes in front of the projects that you want to delete.
Click Delete Projects and confirm your choice in the pop-up that appears.
A message on the Web page shows if the action has been successful.
To temporarily disable deactivate?a project: Click Edit Project and deactivate the Enabled check box. taroth 2012-07-20: todo - find out what it means to enable/disable a project!

procedure.title: Creating Or Deleting Users
procedure.para: When creating a new user, you have to assign the user to a primary project. Before you can delete a user, you need to remove him from his primary project. The user can also be assigned to additional projects.

step.para: On the Admin tab, select the Users category.
To add a new user:
Click Create User.
In the window that opens, enter a User Name and an Email address for the user.
Set a preliminary Password for the user and confirm it.
Assign the user to a Primary Project by selecting the respective project from the drop-down list.
Confirm your changes.
The ‐ automatically assigns an ID and shows the newly created user in the Users category.
To delete one or multiple users:
Activate the check boxes in front of the users that you want to delete.
Click Delete Users and confirm your choice in the pop-up that appears.
A message on the Web page shows if the action has been successful.

note.title: Remove User from Primary Project
note.para: In case a user cannot be deleted, he is still assigned to his primary project.

listitem.para: Edit the user data to view which Primary Project he is assigned to.
Remove the user from his primary project as described in , to .

step.para: To temporarily disable deactivate? a user: Select the user and from the Actions drop-down list, select Disable. taroth 2012-07-23: todo - find out what it means to enable/disable a user!

procedure.title: Modifying User Assignments for a Project
procedure.para: When creating new users, you must assign them to a primary project as described in . To assign users to additional projects or to modify and remove assignments, proceed as follows:

step.para: On the Admin tab, select the Projects category.
Select the project for which to modify user assignments.
From the Actions drop-down list for the project, select Modify Users.
The ‐ shows two lists of users: Users For Project shows the the users assigned to the current project, Add New Users shows other existing users, which can be assigned to the current project.
To remove users from the current project, select one or multiple users and click Remove User or Remove Users.
To assign a user to the current project:
Select the user and click Add To Project.

In the window that appears, set the user's role with which to add him to the project and click Add.
